meanings.definition: The state of having a fever.
meanings.sent1: Her febrility was evident from the flushed cheeks and sweaty forehead.
meanings.sent2: The doctor measured the patient's febrility by checking their temperature.
meanings.sent3: Despite her febrility, she insisted on going to work to finish an important project.
meanings.sent4: The febrility of excitement spread through the crowd as they awaited the announcement.
meanings.sent5: The intense febrility of the summer heat made it hard to stay cool.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being feverish.
meanings.sent1: The child's febrility was concerning, so the parents took him to the doctor.
meanings.sent2: During flu season, many people experience febrility and body aches.
meanings.sent3: Despite his febrility, he managed to crack a joke that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The febrility of anticipation before the big game was palpable in the air.
meanings.sent5: The febrility of anxiety gnawed at her stomach as she waited for the test results.
